text: Eco Lake was a good place to take photos of calm water. It was fun to take pictures of the lake from different angles. The best way to get there is via Botanic Gardens MRT Station and Bukit Timah Gate.

There's a mrt train direct to the garden which is hyper convenient and reachable. The park is decent sized and great for walk, jog or clinics.

It might get hot during the day as some parts are shaded some aren't.

Around a tranquil freshwater lake centre piece at the Eco Lake landscape were planted with a diversity of ecological and economic trees and plants.
Various genus of plants like the bamboo, palm, etc which provided material for traditional kampong house construction, handicrafts, tools, utensils, and as food sources were planted.
A Boardwalk over the lake's edge let visitors observe the Eco Lake above water.
The Eco Lake is also home to a family of beautiful black swans.
Situated inside Bukit Timah core. Just a short walk away from the Botanic Gardens MRT station. Adjacent to Jacob Ballas Children's Garden.
The north side of Botanical Gardens easy access from MRT Botanical Gardens station.  Yoga and Tai Chi Group activities happen around here.
